relation: It is a very organized college. Good quality professors Small size classes
pageTitle: Palm Beach State College Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {383609=For all of your core courses in the college such as math, English, and literature try to attend the English and math lab; there they will help you personally by explaining to you the solution to your problem. Also, in their English lab they assist you with revising your essay projects. Their academic labs help you improve your grammar skills, researching knowledge and much more. The Student Center at the college often has workshops running for students who want to improve their writing in resume, in research papers and so on. Take advantage of all the resources and tools that PBSC provides you with and you will succeed in your classes and accomplish your academic goals., 213675=Serving residents of the western communities of Palm Beach County, the Belle Glade location opened in 1972. The permanent facility was built in 1977 and occupied, 834859=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 205792=A new vendor promising to provide expanded and healthier food alternatives at the Palm Beach State College cafeterias is coming on board in June.The College has signed a contract with Atlanta-based Gourmet Services, Inc. to provide food services at the Lake Worth, Palm Beach Gardens and Boca Raton campuses. Pepe James Café, which already has a contract for the food services in Belle Glade, will continue serving that campus.Gourmet Services, which has been in business for 37 years, will replace College Café. It was selected after a competitive bidding process that included input from College students and employees. It will begin offering its services June 18. Dunkin' Donuts will continue to be offered as an alternative at the Lake Worth and Palm Beach Gardens campuses., 619567=There are no dorms here. I would suggested living with parents or finding a room mate because rent over is pretty expensive. A decent 1 bedroom 1 bath can run you from $800-$1100., 18425=Community College is a great choice for students who don't have too much money to spend for college! For a full time student tuition is only $1000 per semester. On top of that if you have Bright Futures or other scholarship money you pay even less. I only paid around $600 for tuition this semester! You also save money on room and board which costs around $8000. There are no additional daily expenses for students living at home. You or your parents do not have to pay for an extra toothbrush, toothpaste, toilet paper, groceries etc.}

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Venissa from West Palm Beach, FL 08/11/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 10 out of 10 people found this review useful. 2 of 217 Categories Comments Great for these types of students This institute is good for any student who wants to further their education education. Tips for prospective students This institute is a great opportunity You will learn so much.It is very easy but will take all of your dedication as well. Bang for the buck The cost for each class is very manageable. It is a major difference from a university. Apply for financial aid on a website called fasfa.gov.,by doing so you may not have to pay for anything. Am enjoying being here It is a lot of being at the institute.It offers so many activities. The campus is quiet and peaceful as well. The school brings a secure feeling
